Description: Miniature pottery oil-lamp(?) or lid(?) with ring knob and conical body, straight-walled. On the underside is an inner raised ridge (to fit rim of vessel?). Brick-red Nile silt with frequent fine mica and occasional fine lime and red particles. Brown-buff slip or staining covers upper surface.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KE.75) (Phase 3)
